bundle.name: dns

description.p: This bundle installs the Domain Name Server (bind9) on your machine.

bundle.postinst:
# Fixed a few parameters which are considered unsafe by PCI # (these are really just ofuscation of the DNS) if test ! -f /etc/bind/named.conf.options.bak then cp /etc/bind/named.conf.options /etc/bind/named.conf.options.bak fi dns_options -e 'options.version = none' /etc/bind/named.conf.options dns_options -e 'options.hostname = none' /etc/bind/named.conf.options dns_options -e 'options.server-id = none' /etc/bind/named.conf.options
# Install the bind9 jail knowing that fail2ban may not be installed if test ! -d /etc/fail2ban/jail.d then mkdir -p /etc/fail2ban/jail.d chmod 775 /etc/fail2ban chmod 755 /etc/fail2ban/jail.d fi cp /usr/share/snapwebsites/fail2ban/snap-named-jail.conf /etc/fail2ban/jail.d/.
bundle.prerm:
# Remove locally generated files... #rm /etc/bind/*.zone*
# Remove the jail we installed manually rm -f /etc/fail2ban/jail.d/snap-named-jail.conf rmdir --ignore-fail-on-non-empty /etc/fail2ban/jail.d rmdir --ignore-fail-on-non-empty /etc/fail2ban
